topic: How to containerize ETL jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to containerize ETL jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Containerizing ETL Jobs using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a guide on how to containerize Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) jobs using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. The process involves creating a FastAPI application, defining ETL tasks, and deploying the application within a Docker container.
key_points: Understanding the basics of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) jobs
Getting familiar with FastAPI - a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs in Python
Setting up a Python 3.12+ development environment
Creating a basic FastAPI application to handle ETL tasks
Writing the ETL logic within the FastAPI application
Optimizing the FastAPI application for performance and scalability
Building and deploying the Docker container for production
Setting up continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines

code_examples.code:
FROM python:3.12
WORKDIR /app
COPY requirements.txt .
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt
COPY . .
EXPOSE 8000

version_notes: This guide is specifically designed for Python 3.12+
Ensure you have the latest versions of FastAPI, Uvicorn (FastAPI's ASGI server), and other required packages installed.
caveats: Always test your ETL jobs thoroughly before containerizing to ensure data integrity
Monitor the performance of your containerized application and optimize as needed
